column4: Lost my connection: I have a fubared LVM issue: All drives are present and working (according to blkid) but LVM won't find them. Please help?
Is this a new install? reinstall? or did something happen? or what?
Thanks! I swapped motherboards.
Hmm.  Alright.  How many HDDs are we talking?  Are they all SATA? PATA? half and half?
I've got six drives - 1 IDE volume that hosts my system, and 5 storage volumes. (1 IDE, 4 sata)
And they're all on LVM? or just the storage drives?
LVM finds the IDE's ok, but the satas are all missing
just the storage drives.
Interesting.  Alright.  I assume you've got a working system then?  (you can run commands, packages, etc)
Yes, Ubuntu is running, I just can see all my storage
Good, that makes this easier.  Check to make sure you have the 'lvm2' package installed (sudo apt-get install lvm2), and then we'll take a look and see what we can see.
thanks, just a sec
LVM2 is installed and up to date
alright, first thing to do is 'pvscan' to scan all of your physical volumes (this should see and list everything, even the SATA ones)
Mmm, that almost certainly requires sudo.
It throws a large list of "Input/Ouput" errors, and says it can't find various UUID's. the final list shows my IDE drive, but the three PV's that refer to the sata are listed as "Unkown device"

Ah.  I believe there's some communication issue with those SATA drives then.  Do they only support one speed of SATA, and the mobo is trying to talk another (faster, usually) one?  (This is usually solved by jumpers, of all things) or something like that?
That issue is just a wild guess, but if those throw I/O issues, I don't think it's a LVM issue, but a lower level one
could be, I have no idea. I don't think there are any jumpers on the satas themselves, but I've still got my motherboard documentation kicking around somewhere...
Thanks for the suggestion, I'm gonna go do some research

http://linuxwave.blogspot.com/2007/11/mounting-lvm-disk-using-ubuntu-livecd.html walks you through the LVM steps (well, pvscan, vgscan, etc) if yu need to manually activate your storage drive (although with the IDE drive working, I think once you figure whatever else out, the rest of the drives will show up automatically)
